column4: Remote Desktop has SOOO much LAG!, I don't understand as my whole wired network is Gigabit, and System Monitor barely registers a 10% load!, why is Remote Desktop being so laggy, and how can I make is flow like a streaming video?
using Unity?
do you have the desktop effects turned on at all?
there still should be a solution to 10.04!, I mean, 10.04 is not SOO old!
barely any
weird... does that happen for any remote session or just the one host?
I tried once with a computer (that is now stored in a shed) and same crap.
also, what software are you using to perform remote connections?
the default installed one, Vinagre
rdesktop might work
it is GUI
freerdp-x11 might be something to try as well
it says "a later version is already installed! wtf!?!
just open a terminal and type: rdesktop
sorry, I thought rdesktop was GUI... I was wrong
I did, and it just blurted out a loada random what appears to be some sorta MAN page.
I'm gonna go with "yeah"
there is only a version for 11.10 and above :(
oh. perhapas there's a PPA
yup, there is one: https://launchpad.net/~global2000/+archive/freerdp-stable
once you add that, then you can install freerdp via apt
